column8:
Edward gibbon 1737-1794 is considered to be the father of modern historians of ancient rome. His major work - The History of the Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire - afforded him this distinction.
The book has been critisized for it's treatment of the Christian church, in which Gibbon tried to  document it as a historical institute rather than treating it as a special, supernatural case. His views aroused major backlash from christian groups and led to the banning of the book in several countries.
despite this it was a major achievement of the time and it became a backbone for modern historians and still continues to be.
column21: Edward gibbon 1737-1794 is considered to be the father of modern historians of ancient rome. His major work - The History of the Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire - afforded him this distinction. Admire him with unique t-shirt.

column8: Fred Astaire is responsible for some of the greatest tap dance routines ever committed to film. Even if you`re not a fan, watching the man`s timing, sense of rhythm and ingenuity is something to behold.
column21: Fred Astaire T shirt. This shirt can be found under our film category. Dancing, singing. Partnered with Ginger Rogers. Films include Top Hat and That's Entertainment.

column8:
This t-shirt design admires Ganesha , (also known as Ganesh, Ganesa, Ganapati, Vinayaka & Pillaiyer).

One of the world's most popular gods. He is worshipped mainly by the Hindu's, Ganesh rose in popularity during the Indian Gupta period in the 4th & 5th centuries AD, but it actually first appeared in Sri Lanka in the 1st century AD around Mihintale, which is a mountain peak strongly associated with the birth of buddhism within Sri Lanka believe it or not!

Where Ganesh came from we may never know, but he is many peoples favourite deity, including mine, I hope you like my t-shirt design.
column21: This design admires Ganesha , (also known as Ganesh, Ganesa, Ganapati, Vinayaka & Pillaiyer). From weadmire.net.

column8: The first suit I ever owned was in classic grey Glenurquhart check popularly known as Prince of Wales check since it was worn by the dandy Edward VIII when he was Prince of Wales. I was mesmerised by the intricate pattern of dogtooth and check, so much so that it did not occur to me that the clothing I had bought was at least two sizes too big. I wore the simple classic check, but this 200 year old design can often be seen in multiple colours or combined with coloured over-checks to contrast the monotone pattern.

I have always been fascinated with anatomy, having to study the human body in Biology at school and also in my drawing classes at University.  I find the drawings very intrinsic and beautiful and are also invaluable on learning how to capture a realistic drawing or painting of the human form.  The design is an illustration of the heart, ribs and dissected lungs, a sophisticated pump and oxygenator that i can't help but admire.
column21: The design is an illustration of the heart, ribs and dissected lungs, a sophisticated pump and oxygenator that I can't help but admire.

column8:
This design admires the Homburg hat and those who have been known to wear it.
The homburg is a stylish hat that became popular during the late 19th century after King Edward VII returned from Bad Homburg vor der Hohe, Germany wearing one.
Since then it has remained in fashion almost constantly, being especially popular with bankers & gangsters!
column21: A t-shirt that admires the iconic Homburg Hat, worn by gangsters, rappers and actors alike

column8: Hook, line & sinker. An old idiom meaning 'completely', as in: if someone is taken with an idea completely, they are taken 'hook line and sinker'.
column21: Hook line and sinker t-shirt from weadmire.net
